Segmenter Class Reference

#include <Segmenter.hpp>

Collaboration diagram for Segmenter:

Detailed Description

Segmenter of the OCR process.

This class encapsulates all the methods related to segmentation stage. Its task is to isolate every shape within a clip that represents a character, storing them in a data structure for further classification.

See also:
Clip, Shape, Pixel
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-13

Definition at line 265 of file Segmenter.hpp.

void Segmenter::applyThreshold ( Clip &  clip,
const unsigned char &  threshold,
const unsigned char &  backgroundReference 
)

Applies the threshold algorithm.

Parameters:
clip Press clip
threshold Threshold value to differentiate between back- and foreground pixels
backgroundReference Background reference gray level
Postcondition:
Every pixel has either a gray level of 0 or 255.

The inkValue_ member is initialized to the gray level that represents the ink's gray level

See also:
Clip
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-13
Simple thresholding that compares each pixel's gray level with a threshold value. The background reference gray level is taken into account to decide the final gray level that must be applied to the pixel.

Definition at line 34 of file Segmenter.cpp.

Referenced by Recognizer::obtainText().

void Segmenter::applyFloodFill ( const Clip &  clip  ) 

Applies the flood fill algorithm.

Precondition:
The clip MUST be thresholded by calling applyThreshold() method before.
Postcondition:
The seeds_ member is initialized with the pixels that generates each shape found.

The shapes_ member is initialized with the shapes that represents character within the clip.

Parameters:
clip Press clip
See also:
Clip
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-13
The 'flood fill' algorithm is a segmentation technique that isolates every shape in a clip that represents a character. Every shape is built starting from a seed, i.e. an ink pixel, exploring its neighbourhood and adding every ink pixel that is connected to the seed. The process ends when there are not more seeds to explore and the shapes are completely isolated.

3. Sort shapes according to their position within the clip

void Segmenter::findSeeds ( const Clip &  clip  )  [private]

Finds all the ink pixels within a clip that may grow up as a shape.

Precondition:
The clip MUST be thresholded by calling applyThreshold() method before.
Postcondition:
The seeds_ member is initialized with all the ink pixels within the clip
Parameters:
clip The press clip
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-17
All the pixels of the clip are explored, adding to the vector of seeds_ those whose gray level is equal to the ink's gray level stablished in inkValue_ member.

Definition at line 133 of file Segmenter.cpp.

Referenced by exploreSeedNeighbourhood().

void Segmenter::exploreSeedNeighbourhood ( const Pixel &  seed,
const Clip &  clip 
) [private]

Makes a recursive exploration searching for ink pixels that are neighbours of the pixel passed building a Shape.

Postcondition:
A new Shape object is added to shapes_.

The pixels that belongs to the new Shape object are removed from seeds_.

Parameters:
seed The pixel where starting the exploration from
clip The clip where doing the exploration
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-10-18
